description: Permanent residential mooring for a single vessel with associated re-grading of the existing river bed and installation of two timber piles.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (1817-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-0004 Rev P03, received: 03/07/2019.
1817-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-0001 Rev P01, 1817-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-0002 Rev P03, 1817-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-0003 Rev P05, 1817-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-0004 Rev P04, 1817-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-0005 Rev P02, 1817-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-0006 Rev P02, and 1817-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-0007 Rev P01, received: 20/08/2019.
Flood Risk Assessment dated November 2019, and Operational Management Plan Rev C dated November 2019, received: 20/11/2019.
Method Statement - Piling and Regrading ref: 1817-BRL-01-XX-TN-C-0001 P03, Environmental Statement ref: 1817-BRL-01-XX-TN-C-0002 Rev P02: Received 10/02/2020) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - Other than the re-grading hereby approved, there shall be no dredging, digging, levelling or any other alteration of the Thames riverbank or riverbed under or in the vicinity of the site in association with the implementation of this permission or subsequently in association with the approved development.
Condition : 4 - The mooring shall be provided with a means of access to mains electricity when the development hereby approved is first implemented and this shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Condition : 5 - The occupants of any vessel using the mooring shall not use generators and no maintenance shall be carried out on a boat while moored at the site.
Condition : 6 - The residential mooring hereby approved shall be maintained in accordance with the management plan (Operational Management Plan Rev C) submitted with the application.

Condition : 7 - Any service bollard approved shall be located on the riverside edge of the riverside walkway and shall not project more than 400 mm into the walkway, shall not exceed 500 mm in width and shall not exceed one metre in height.  The provision shall include an integral mail delivery box.

Condition : 8 - The access point to the mooring from the walkway shall be secured with gates to match the existing approved design of the riverside walkway balustrade as approved under planning permission 00607/41/P28 and shall not exceed 1.2 metres in width.  The gates shall be designed to self close and shall be kept closed except when in use.  They shall allow exit from the river without a key, but access in the opposite direction only with the use of a key. No refuse or other materials or personal effects shall be stored on the walkway.
Condition : 9 - No more than one boat shall be moored at the site.  It shall be moored parallel and immediately adjacent to the bank. It shall not exceed five metres in beam and 35 metres length.
Condition : 10 - The boat moored at the site shall be restricted to a single level of accommodation with no superstructure exceeding two metres in height.

Condition : 11 - Nothing shall be fixed to the railings of the walkway other than the lifesaving equipment referred to in Condition 13, any necessary service bollard and a mooring nameplate for the boat, not exceeding 30 cm high by 60 cm wide.

Condition : 12 - Notwithstanding the approved plans, prior to the first use or occupation of development, full details of the arrangements for the storing of waste and recycled materials, including their location, means of enclosure and management, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter, these arrangements shall be implemented in accordance with the agreed details unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 13 - Before the mooring is first brought into use, the following safety measures shall be installed and permanently maintained in a state fit for their intended use thereafter.
Adjacent to the entrance to the mooring, the developer shall provide a set of publicly accessible life saving equipment to be fixed to the landward side of the riverside safety railings which shall be accompanied by appropriate signage to identify the equipment, all to comply with BS 5499-11: 2002.  The installation shall include contact details of the site manager that must be kept up to date at all times requesting reports of any damage or misuse and the installation shall be inspected on a monthly basis or more frequently, or after any reported use of the equipment, or if it is reported as damaged, and any equipment or signage that needs replacing shall be replaced within five days.
The life saving equipment shall comprise at one lifebuoy in a weatherproof housing.  The lifebuoy shall be constructed in tough weatherproof fire retardant PVC material, attached to a 30 m x 8 mm diameter polyethylene rope in a vandal-resistant high visibility housing with the lifebuoys designed to be easily released in the event of an emergency. The installation shall be fully compliant with Chapter III of the Life Saving Appliances code as per the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea (SOLAS) or any replacement or equivalent specification. 
In addition:
An escape ladder shall be fixed to the river wall adjacent to and accessible from the gangway access gates to the mooring for anybody attempting to climb out of the river.  It shall be manufactured from mild steel with 5O mm x 1O mm stringers 5OO mm apart and 19 mm diameter rungs at 315 mm centres. It shall be fabricated so as to reach from the foreshore to the top of the river wall (including any solid parapet) and be fitted with brackets so that the rings are 150 mm from the face of the wall. The ladder including ferrous fixings shall be hot
